article.headline: Charlotte 105, Old Dominion 102 (2OT)
article.story: NORFOLK, Va. (AP) -- Brendan Plavich made two 3-pointers in the second overtime, including the game-winner with seven seconds remaining, and Charlotte outlasted Old Dominion 105-102 on Saturday night. The 49ers (4-2), who got a tying layup from Eddie Basden with :02 left in the first overtime, never trailed but were tied twice in the second extra period. Each time, Plavich broke the tie with 3-pointers, his third and fourth of the game. Old Dominion (1-3), which got a layup from Drew Williamson with :03 left in regulation to force the first overtime, lost despite a career-high 45 points and 15 rebounds from Alex Loughton. He had nine points in the first extra period, but was limited to no shots from the field and one free throw in the second. Loughton finished 17-for-23 from the field, including 5-for-5 on 3-pointers. Demon Brown scored four of his 26 points in the second overtime to put the 49ers ahead 99-95, but Troy Nance made a 3-pointer for the Monarchs with 3:18 left and Loughton added a free throw with 2:38 to play to create the first tie. After Plavich made the first of his two 3-pointers in the second overtime, Nance answered for the Monarchs, setting the stage of Plavich's second big shot. Plavich finished with 16 points for Charlotte, Basden had 14 and Curtis Withers 13. Old Dominion also got 14 points from Arnaud Dahi and 12 from Isaiah Hunter.
